page.title: 12Home life 2
page.content: There is a small general store in Rushmere but no services in Henstead so all those surveyed made regular shopping excursions every week out of the area. 66% of households went to Lowestoft, 14% to Kessingland, 14% to Beccles and 6% to Oulton Broad. 88% of households excluding farms supplied some of their own food. Of these 61% grew vegetables, 26% grew fruit &13% kept chickens or ducks for eggs. 88% of households kept pets, cats(52%), dogs(38%) and caged birds(9%). Others were ducks, rabbits fish and chipmunk. All of the sample study group had television and radio. 90% had a telephone; very essential when related to the lack of public transport in the area. 80% of households had at least one employed person. The other 20% were retired. Only 25% of the employed worked in the region,in agriculture.
